ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: CMS Generation Michigan Power LLC FERC Schedule No. 1 Electric Tariff

record_data.record_title: CMS Generation MI Pwr LLC Pwr Sales & Reactive Sup Volt Tari
record_data.record_narrative_name: CMS Generation Michigan Power L.L.C. Power Sales and Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service Tariff
record_data.record_plain_text: CMS GENERATION MICHIGAN POWER, L.L.C. POWER SALES AND REACTIVE SUPPLY AND VOLTAGE CONTROL SERVICE TARIFF Table of Contents Page SECTION 1 - GENERAL PURPOSES SECTION 2 – DEFINITIONS SECTION 3 - SERVICES TO BE RENDERED3.1 Services Provided3.2 Service Schedule Revisions and Additions3.3 Service Agreement3.4 Confirmation Document3.5 Transmission Arrangements3.6 Transmission and Ancillary Service Arrangements3.6.1 Buyer Arranges Transmission3.6.2 Seller Arranges Transmission SECTION 4 - OPERATIONS4.1 Prudent Utility Practice4.2 Operating Responsibilities4.3 Interruption of Service4.4 Delivery Points4.5 Synchronous Operation4.6 Scheduling SECTION 5 - RECORDS, BILLING AND PAYMENTS5.1 Records5.2 Billing Period5.3 Estimated Billing Factors5.4 Timeliness of Payment5.5 Disputed Bills5.6 Billing Adjustments5.7 Defaults5.8 Tax Reimbursement5.9 Out-of-Pocket Costs SECTION 6 - INDEMNITY AND CREDIT WORTHINESS6.1 Indemnity6.2 Credit Worthiness SECTION 7 - DISPUTES AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION7.1 Disputes7.2 Arbitration Notice7.3 Arbitration Rules7.4 Procedures7.5 Expenses7.6 Awards7.7 Other Tariff Provisions SECTION 8 - GENERAL PROVISIONS8.1 Term and Termination8.2 Regulatory Authorities8.3 Force Majeure8.4 Waivers8.5 Limitation of Liability8.6 Continuation of Tariff Provisions8.7 Written Notices8.8 Assignment8.9 Governing Law8.10 Section Headings8.11 Modification By Agreement SERVICE SCHEDULE A SERVICE SCHEDULE B APPENDIX 118 SECTION 1 - GENERAL PURPOSES 1.1 The purpose of this Tariff is to set forth the terms, conditions, and Service Schedules allowing CMS Generation Michigan Power, L.L.C. (Seller) to sell Capacity, Energy, and Ancillary Services. 1.2 All transactions under this Tariff shall be voluntary and subject to the availability of Capacity and/or Energy to complete the transaction. Seller does not warrant that it has any Capacity and/or Energy available for sale hereunder and does not commit to enter into any individual transaction with any Eligible Entity. An Eligible Entity that executes a Service Agreement under this Tariff with Seller does not commit to enter into any individual transactions with Seller. SECTION 2 – DEFINITIONS The following words and terms as used herein shall be understood to have the meanings set forth below. 2.1 "Agent" means an authorized brokering entity, which will act for Seller or for the Buyer as set forth in its applicable contract with Seller or with the buyer. 2.2 "Buyer" means an Eligible Entity that has entered into a Service Agreement pursuant to this Tariff. 2.3 "Capacity" means the maximum hourly amount of electric energy that Seller agrees to sell and Buyer reserves for purchase pursuant to a transaction arranged under a Service Agreement. 2.4 "Confirmation Document" means a letter or other document which provides the respective understandings between Seller and the Buyer for a specific transaction per a Service Schedule under this Tariff written in a form acceptable to Seller. 2.5 "Commission" or "FERC" means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or such successor regulatory agency as may have jurisdiction over this Tariff. 2.6 "Eligible Entity" means a private or public corporation, governmental agency or authority, municipality, rural electric membership corporation or cooperative, person or lawful association of any of the foregoing, that engages in the generation, transmission, distribution, purchase or sale of electric energy to which it has title at wholesale or retail and which is subject to regulation with respect to rates or services under the laws of the state where such entity renders electric utility service, or pursuant to the Federal Power Act, or is legally exempt from such regulation. The term "Eligible Entity" shall not include ultimate consumers of electric utility service or any entity on whose behalf the FERC is prohibited from issuing a mandatory wheeling order under Section 722 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992. 2.7 "Energy" means the amount of electric energy that Buyer schedules for purchase, in any hour or in aggregate, pursuant to a transaction arranged with Seller under a Service Agreement. 2.8 "Loop Flows" means using transmission directly or indirectly on the facilities of a utility system other than the system(s) on the contract path. 2.9 "Party" or "Parties means either Seller or an Eligible Entity that has become a Buyer by executing a Service Agreement with Seller, or both. 2.10 "Point of Delivery" ("POD") means a point or points for delivery of energy or reactive power from Seller to Buyer specified in a Confirmation Document. 2.11 "Prudent Utility Practice" means, at a particular time, any of the practices, methods or acts which, in the exercise of reasonable judgment in light of the facts known at the time the decision was made, would have been expected to accomplish the desired result at reasonable cost consistent with reliability, safety, expedition and the requirements of governmental agencies having jurisdiction. Such practices, methods or acts shall include, but not be limited to, any of the practices, methods or acts engaged in or approved by a significant portion of the electric utility industry prior to the time the decision was made. Prudent Utility Practices are not intended to be limited to any particular set of optimum practices, methods or acts to the exclusion of all others, but rather are intended to include a range of possible practices, methods or acts consistent with the above-stated criteria. 2.12 "Receiving Party" means the Buyer or an entity designated by the Buyer to receive, at a specified Point of Delivery, the services provided under a Confirmation Document. A Receiving Party must be an Eligible Entity as defined in Subsection 2.7. 2.13 "Seller" means CMS Generation Michigan Power, L.L.C., a Michigan limited liability company, with corporate offices at One Energy Plaza, Jackson, Michigan49201. 2.14 "Seller's Power Resources" means the generation resources of Seller other than purchased power. 2.15 "Service Agreement" means the initial agreement for service under this Tariff, to be substantially in the form of Appendix I attached to this Tariff, and any supplements and amendments thereto entered into by an Eligible Entity and Seller. SECTION 3 - SERVICES TO BE RENDERED 3.1 Services Provided Inasmuch as they may vary from time to time, the specific services to be rendered hereunder and the rates, terms and conditions applicable thereto shall be set forth in a Service Schedule or Service Schedules, which shall be part of this Tariff. The terms and provisions of this Tariff and of the following Service Schedule shall govern such transactions as the Parties may from time to time agree to undertake: Service Schedule A - Negotiated Capacity and Energy Service Schedule B - Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service 3.2 Service Schedule Revisions and Additions Changes in the terms and conditions of the above Service Schedule and any additional Service Schedules which Seller may wish to establish in the future shall beset forth in modifications to the Tariff, or made pursuant to Subsection 8.2. Service Schedules may be cancelled upon 30 days written notice; however, no such cancellation shall affect any particular transaction agreed to pursuant to any Service Schedule prior to the notice of cancellation of such Schedule. During such time, all the provisions of the Tariff which apply shall remain in force with regards to such transaction, even though this Tariff or certain provisions may have been cancelled in the interim. 3.3 Service Agreement In order for Eligible Entities to take service under this Tariff, a Service Agreement must be executed by the Eligible Entity and Seller. 3.4 Confirmation Document A Confirmation Document shall be written and signed by both Parties to document the agreements and understandings relating to a particular transaction arranged pursuant to this Tariff. For transactions lasting longer than one month, such Confirmation Document must be written before the transaction can commence. For transactions of one month or less, verbal agreement, later confirmed by the written Confirmation Document, if requested by Seller, is acceptable. 3.5 Transmission Arrangements Use of any third party's transmission system for delivery of the services reserved under this Tariff must be arranged by the Buyer (except as otherwise agreed pursuant to Subsection 3.6.2) under terms and conditions contained in the open access transmission tariff of any party providing transmission service. 3.6 Transmission and Ancillary Service Arrangements 3.6.1 Buyer Arranges Transmission Unless Seller and the Buyer agree otherwise under Subsection 3.6.2 below, the Buyer shall arrange for and assume full financial responsibility for all necessary transmission service and ancillary services with third parties. To the extent that such third parties seek to impose charges for such transmission service with respect to transactions under this Tariff, Seller shall be under no obligation to collect charges on behalf of, or to remit payments to, any other utility in connection with the delivery of services under a transaction to the Buyer. As between Seller and the Buyer, claims or demands made by other utilities arising out of a transaction hereunder in respect of the claimed use of the transmission systems of such third parties shall be the sole responsibility of the Buyer except to the extent otherwise agreed under Subsection 3.6.2 below. 3.6.2 Seller Arranges Transmission Seller and the Buyer may agree that Seller will arrange and pay for any transmission service from third parties (including any Loop Flows)required for any transaction under this Tariff. Seller and the Buyer shall agree upon the firmness of the third party transmission service to be arranged. Invoices for all transactions in which Seller arranges transmission shall separately state the charges for wholesale generation, transmission and ancillary services. In addition, the Buyer shall reimburse Seller for all third party transmission service charges, if any, identified in the Confirmation Document, including any gross receipts or similar taxes paid by Seller in connection with such third party transmission service. SECTION 4 - OPERATIONS 4.1 Prudent Utility Practice Each Party shall exercise reasonable care to maintain and operate its facilities and arrange to meet its obligations in accordance with Prudent Utility Practice. 4.2 Operating Responsibilities Operating arrangements for transactions pursuant to this Tariff shall be coordinated among personnel of Seller, Buyer and personnel of other parties affected by such transactions. 4.3 Interruption of Service Each party shall exercise reasonable care to maintain the continuity of all service provided under this Tariff; however, both firm and non-firm transactions may be interrupted or reduced pursuant to Prudent Utility Practice under the following circumstances: (a) transmission curtailment or interruption by any transmission provider pursuant to an open access transmission tariff, (b) at any time that, in thesole judgment of Seller, such action is necessary to preserve the integrity of itsgeneration system, or (c) at any time that the Buyer is in default for more than 15days in the payment of any bill rendered hereunder, provided that Seller has notifiedthe FERC and the affected party of such impending suspension of service. The Buyer will be obligated to have adequate arrangements in place to facilitatecurtailment or interruption of any transaction. Buyer will be obligated to take allsteps necessary to promptly interrupt or curtail any transaction when requested bySeller. Unless otherwise agreed to in the Confirmation Document, the Buyer shall remainliable to Seller for demand or reservation charges associated with transactions agreedto prior to any interruption except in such instances where it is Seller's generationsupply which is the cause of the interruption. In circumstances where the interruptionoccurs on Seller's generation supply, compensation for demand or reservationcharges shall be adjusted, if at all, as specified in the Confirmation Document. 4.4 Delivery Points All electric energy delivered under this Tariff shall be of the character commonlyknown as three-phase 60 Hz energy and shall be delivered at nominal voltages at thePoint of Delivery as specified in a transaction arranged pursuant to a ConfirmationDocument. Title to energy delivered hereunder shall transfer from Seller to Buyer atthe Point of Delivery. 4.5 Synchronous Operation It is the intent of Seller and the Buyer that within the realm of their control, theelectric systems interconnected with Seller and the Buyer be operated in synchronousfashion. If synchronous operation of such systems is interrupted because of reasonsbeyond the control of either Seller or the Buyer, or because of scheduled constructionor maintenance, Seller and the Buyer shall cooperate with each other and with theintervening systems to remove the cause of such interruption as soon as practicableand restore such systems to a normal condition. 4.6 Scheduling All Energy and reactive supply sold hereunder shall be delivered and billed on ascheduled basis in accordance with the applicable schedule and the agreed upon termsof a particular transaction. Unless Seller and the Buyer mutually agree otherwise, schedules for the delivery ofCapacity and Energy under Service Schedule A shall be set and agreed upon by Sellerand the Buyer by l0 AM of the work day prior to the day on which service is to beprovided. Unless Seller and the Buyer mutually agree otherwise, changes topreviously agreed to schedules for the delivery of hourly capacity and energy shall beset and agreed upon by Seller and the Buyer no later than twenty (20) minutes prior tothe hour during which service to be provided commences. Schedules for delivery under Service Schedule B, shall be as defined in the Confirmation Document. Seller and the Buyer shall designate to the other in writing the persons authorized to transact business on its behalf hereunder and the scope of their authority, and shallprovide the telephone and facsimile numbers or other means (e-mail, etc) which shallbe employed for communications hereunder. SECTION 5 - RECORDS, BILLING AND PAYMENTS 5.1 Records Seller and the Buyer shall keep such records as may be needed to afford a clearhistory of all transactions under this Tariff. The originals of all such records shall beretained by the Party developing the original records and copies shall be delivered tothe other Party upon request. 5.2 Billing Period Unless otherwise agreed upon, the calendar month shall be the standard billing periodfor all settlements under this Tariff. As soon as practicable after the end of eachbilling period, Seller shall cause to be prepared a statement in such detail as may beneeded for settlements under this Tariff. 5.3 Estimated Billing Factors In order that bills may be rendered promptly after the end of each month, it may benecessary from time to time, to estimate certain factors involved in calculating themonthly billing. Any adjustments necessary to such estimates shall be included in thebill for the month following the time when information becomes available to makesuch adjustments in the billing for the preceding month or months.5.4 Timeliness of Payment Unless otherwise agreed upon, all bills for service under this Tariff shall be due andpayable on the tenth (10) day from the date of rendering of a bill, or the first bankingday thereafter if the payment day falls on other than a banking day. Payment of suchbills shall be made by electronic transfer or by such other means as shall cause suchpayment to be available for the use of the payee on or before the date due. Interest onunpaid amounts shall accrue from the date due until the date upon which payment ismade, at an annual percentage rate of interest equal to the lesser of (i) the prime ratepublished by the Wall Street Journal (which represents the base rate on corporateloans posted by at least 75% of the nation's banks) on the due date, plus 2%, or (ii)the highest rate permitted by law. 5.5 Disputed Bills In the event the Buyer wishes to contest a portion of a billed amount, said Buyer shallpay the portion of the bill that is not being contested, pursuant to Subsection 5.4above. Interest shall accrue on the unpaid portion of the bill at the rate specified inSubsection 5.4 while resolution of contested amounts is pending. Either Party may seek resolution, pursuant to the provisions of Section 7, of any disputes which cannotbe resolved in the normal course of business. 5.6 Billing Adjustments Other than as required by law or regulatory action, requests by either party forrefunds on or adjustments regarding any transaction must be made by the requestingParty within twelve (12) months of the receipt of the initial bill for such transaction. 5.7 Defaults In the event the Buyer fails to make timely payment in accordance with this Section 5, and such failure is not corrected within fifteen (15) calendar days after notification to cure such failure, a default shall be deemed to exist. Upon the occurrence of a default, (a) Seller may immediately cease scheduling, or otherwise supplying services provided under this Agreement until the default is cured by payment, and (b) Seller's obligation under the Agreement may be terminated upon a filing of notice of cancellation pursuant to the regulations of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, and Seller may initiate any regulatory or legal proceeding to terminate and/or enforce this Agreement. 5.8 Tax Reimbursement It is expressly agreed by the Parties that, as part of the compensation to be paid underthis Tariff, and under each Service Schedule annexed to and made part of this Tariff,if at any time during the term hereof there should be levied and/or assessed againstSeller, any direct tax, including, but not limited to environmental (carbon content orotherwise) or similar taxes (other than taxes based on or measured by net income), byany taxing authority on the power and/or energy manufactured, generated, produced,converted, sold, purchased, interchanged, exchanged, exported or imported by Selleron behalf of the Buyer, Seller shall be entitled to full compensation by the Buyer forsuch taxes. The Parties also agree that prior approval of any regulatory body havingjurisdiction in such matter, if required, shall be obtained as a prerequisite to collectionof such direct tax. 5.9 Out-of-Pocket Costs Unless otherwise specified in the Confirmation Document, "Out-of-Pocket Costs", asit applies to services arranged pursuant to this Tariff, shall mean all expenses incurredby Seller that would not otherwise have been incurred if the corresponding servicehad not been arranged. Such expenses will include, but are not limited to, fuel,reactant, operation, maintenance, tax, SO2 and other atmospheric emissionallowances, transmission losses, and other expenses incurred which would not havebeen incurred if the service had not been arranged. Emission allowances will not beincluded in Out-of-Pocket Costs unless Seller has made an accepted filing underSection 205 of the Federal Power Act specifying procedures for recovery thereof. SECTION 6 - INDEMNITY AND CREDIT WORTHINESS 6.1 Indemnity Notwithstanding the provisions of any other section of this tariff to the contrary, theBuyer shall at all times assume all liability for, and shall indemnify and save Sellerharmless from any and all damages, losses, claims, demands, suits, recoveries, costsand expenses for injury to or death of any person or persons whomsoever occurringon the Buyer's own system, or for any loss, destruction of or damage to any propertyof third persons, firms, corporations, or other entities, occurring on the Buyer's ownsystem, arising out of or resulting from, either directly or indirectly, the Buyer'sfacilities, or arising out of or resulting from, either directly or indirectly, the electricenergy sold hereunder after it has been delivered by Seller to the Buyer, provided,however, that the Buyer shall have no obligation under this section in cases where theevents described herein were caused by gross negligence or intentional wrongdoingof Seller. 6.2 Credit Worthiness For the purpose of determining the ability of the Buyer to meet its obligations relatedto service hereunder, Seller may require reasonable credit review procedures whichmay include, but not be limited to, verification that the Buyer is not operating underany state or federal bankruptcy laws, is not subject to the uncertainty of pendingliquidation or regulatory proceedings in state or federal courts, and that no significantcollection lawsuits or judgments are outstanding which would seriously affect theBuyer's ability, in Seller's sole determination, to remain solvent. As part of this process, the Buyer may be required to furnish Seller with its company's financial reports and/or its reports to share owners. Specifically, the Buyer will be considered credit worthy upon satisfying the previousparagraph and one or more of the following conditions: 6.2.1 At the time it enters into a transaction and throughout the term thereof, theBuyer provides Seller evidence that its long term unsecured debt securitiesare rated BBB- or better by Standard & Poor's Corporation, or Baa3 orbetter by Moody's Investor Service, or that its common stock is rated B+ orbetter by Standard and Poor's Corporation, it being the Buyer's obligation tonotify Seller of any downward changes in such ratings. If Seller is aware ofany material adverse changes in Buyer's business since the last issuance ofsuch ratings, Seller may additionally require that any of the following itemsbe satisfied. 6.2.2 The Buyer either prepays for service or provides an unconditional letter ofcredit for an account equal to or greater than the total charges for the term ofthe transaction. Any letter of credit provided to Seller must be issued by acommercial bank or financial institution located in the United States orCanada whose long-term unsecured debt securities are rated A or better byStandard & Poor's Corporation or A2 or better by Moody's Investor Service, Inc., or comparable rating by another rating service acceptable to Seller in its sole discretion. 6.2.3 The Buyer has, in Seller's sole discretion, a qualified long term payment history with Seller. 6.2.4 Seller receives a written guarantee from the Buyer's parent company (if applicable) that the parent will be unconditionally responsible for all financial obligations associated with the transaction, and the Buyer's parent company qualifies as credit worthy pursuant to one or more of the provisions of this subsection. SECTION 7 - DISPUTES AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION 7.1 Disputes In the event of a dispute between Seller and the Buyer arising out of or in connectionwith this Tariff, the following shall apply: (a) The Party to a Service Agreement under this Tariff with a matter they wish to dispute, shall serve notice in writing upon the other Party, which notice shall contain a statement setting forth the nature of the dispute, the amount involved, if any, and the remedy sought. (b) If the dispute is not resolved within thirty (30) days of service of written notice in Subsection (a) above by one of the Parties to the other of such dispute, each Party will appoint one of its officers to an ad hoc committee of two. The officers shall be Vice Presidents or executives of similar responsibility level or higher with settlement authority. They shall attempt to mutually resolve the dispute. (c) If the dispute is not resolved within ninety (90) days of the service of the notice in Subsection (a) above, such dispute may, by mutual agreement, be submitted to arbitration in the manner hereinafter set forth; provided, however, that in no event shall arbitration be requested beyond three (3) years after the end of the billing month in dispute. Except as provided in Subsection 5.7, during the course of resolving the dispute, theParties to any Service Agreement under this Tariff shall allow the services providedunder such agreement to continue, pending such resolution. 7.2 Arbitration Notice The Party to a Service Agreement under this Tariff calling for arbitration shall serve a second notice in writing upon the other Party, which notice shall contain a statement setting forth the nature of the dispute, the amount involved, if any, and the remedy sought. The Buyer and Seller thereupon shall endeavor to agree upon and appoint one person to act as sole arbitrator. If the Parties fail so to agree within a period of fifteen (15) days from service of the arbitration notice, the Party calling for the arbitration, upon five (5) days' written notice to the other Party, may apply to the American Arbitration Association for the appointment of a single arbitrator skilled in the particular matter which is the subject of dispute. 7.3 Arbitration Rules The dispute shall be arbitrated pursuant to the Commercial Arbitration Rules of theAmerican Arbitration Association. The arbitration proceedings shall be conducted ata location selected by the Parties, or the Arbitrator if the Parties are unable to agree. 7.4 Procedures The sole arbitrator shall establish the procedure and procedural schedule for the arbitration and shall afford adequate opportunity to the Parties to the arbitration to present information with respect to the dispute or disagreement issues submitted for arbitration, and may request further information from either Party to the Service Agreement under this Tariff. A complete record shall be kept of all proceedings. The arbitrator shall make its award promptly, and no later than thirty (30) days from the date of closing the hearing, but the Parties may agree, at any time prior to the making of such award, on an extension of such period, whether or not previously extended. All awards shall be made in writing, and an original of the award shall be furnished to each of the Parties. 7.5 Expenses Each Party shall pay for its own expenses. If there is arbitration, all other costs incurred in connection with such arbitration shall be paid in equal parts by the Parties, unless the award shall specify a different division of the costs. 7.6 Awards The findings and award of the sole arbitrator shall be final and conclusive with respect to the dispute or disagreement issues submitted for arbitration and shall be binding upon the Parties. Judgment upon an award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court of competent jurisdiction. 7.7 Other Tariff Provisions The Parties agree that the provisions of this Section 7 notwithstanding, matters whichare the subject of Section 8 shall not be submitted to Arbitration. SECTION 8 - GENERAL PROVISIONS 8.1 Term and Termination This Tariff shall be effective as of the date specified by order of the FERC or any regulatory authority having jurisdiction, and it shall remain in effect until terminated or superseded by an action or notice of cancellation of the Tariff being accepted for filing by the FERC or successor regulatory agency having jurisdiction. The applicable provisions of this Tariff and any Service Agreement entered into under this Tariff shall continue in effect after termination or cancellation thereof to the extent necessary to provide for final billing, billing adjustments and payments. 8.2 Regulatory Authorities This Tariff is made subject to the jurisdiction of any governmental authority or authorities having jurisdiction in the premises. Nothing contained in this Tariff shall be construed as affecting in any way, the right of Seller to unilaterally make application to FERC for a change in rates, charges, classification, service or any rule, regulation or contract relating thereto under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act and Pursuant to the Commission Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder. 8.3 Force Majeure The term "Force Majeure" shall be deemed for the purpose of this tariff to mean earthquake, storm, lightning, flood, backwater caused by flood, fire, explosion, act of the public enemy, epidemic, accident, failure of facilities, equipment or fuel supply, acts of God, war, riot, civil disturbances, strike, labor disturbances, labor or material shortage, national emergency, restraint by court order or other public authority or governmental agency, or other similar causes beyond the control of the Party affected which causes such Party could not have avoided by exercise of due diligence and reasonable care. Nothing contained herein shall be construed to require a Party to settle any strike, lockout, work stoppage or other industrial disturbance or dispute in which it may be involved or to take an appeal from any judicial, regulatory or administrative action. Any Party rendered unable to fulfill any of its obligations under this Tariff, the Service Agreement or the Confirmation Document by reason of Force Majeure shall exercise due diligence to remove such inability with all reasonable dispatch. In the event any Party is unable, in whole or in part, to perform any of its obligations (except for Buyer's obligation to pay for service provided pursuant to this Tariff) by reason of Force Majeure, then the obligations of the Party relying thereon, insofar as such obligations are affected by such Force Majeure, shall be suspended during the continuance thereof but no longer. The Party invoking the Force Majeure shall specifically state the full particulars of the Force Majeure and the time and date when the Force Majeure occurred. Notices given under the provisions of this section shall be confirmed in writing as soon as reasonably possible. When the Force Majeure ceases, the Party relying thereon shall give immediate notice thereof to the other Parties. This Tariff shall not be terminated by reason of ForceMajeure but shall remain in full force and effect. 8.4 Waivers Any waiver at any time of any rights as to any default or other matter arising hereunder shall not be deemed a waiver as to any subsequent default or matter. Any delay, short of exceeding any applicable statute of limitation, in asserting or enforcing any right hereunder shall not be deemed a waiver of such right. 8.5 Limitation of Liability No Party hereto shall be liable for any consequential, incidental, punitive or other special damages relating to the performance or nonperformance of its obligations under this Tariff or any transaction hereunder. No other entity is intended to be a third party beneficiary under this Tariff and no cause of action, whether in tort, contract, or otherwise, may be based in whole or in part upon breach of this Tariff by any entity other than Seller or the Buyer. 8.6 Continuation of Tariff Provisions If any one or more provisions contained herein shall be finally determined by anyregulatory authority or court of competent jurisdiction to contravene, or be invalid under, any applicable provision of law, such contravention or invalidity shall not invalidate this Tariff, but this Tariff shall be construed as if not containing such provision or provisions and the rights and obligations of the Parties shall be construed and enforced accordingly. In the event that an occasion shall arise requiring that this Tariff be construed as if not containing a particular provision or provisions as aforesaid and the effect thereof shall be to impose on any Party to a Service Agreement hereunder an obligation other than those herein provided (except for changes in rates or charges), the Parties will negotiate in good faith to provide a substitute for such provision or provisions, but no such substitute shall be binding on either Party unless stated expressly in a written document executed and delivered by each of the Parties to such agreement and filed with and accepted for filing by such regulatory authorities as shall have jurisdiction. 8.7 Written Notices Any written notice required or appropriate hereunder shall be deemed properly made,given to, or served on the Party to which it is directed, when sent by United States mail, postage prepaid, and addressed as specified in the applicable Service Agreement. Any written notice required or appropriate hereunder may also be sent by electronicmeans. 8.8 Assignment The rights of any party pursuant to a Service Agreement under this Tariff shall not be assigned, pledged or otherwise transferred without the prior written consent of the other Parties. Said consent shall not be unreasonably withheld. In the event of such mutually agreed assignment, any such assignee or transferee shall be required to assume all of the obligations of the assignor or transferor under this Tariff pursuant to a written agreement which is acceptable to the non-assigning Parties. 8.9 Governing Law The formation, validity interpretation, execution, amendment and termination of this Tariff shall be governed by the laws of the State of Michigan and any actions with respect thereto may be brought only in a court of competent jurisdiction in Michigan. 8.10 Section Headings The descriptive headings of the various Sections of this Tariff or any Service Agreement entered into hereunder have been inserted for convenience of reference only and shall not modify or restrict any of the terms and provisions thereof. 8.11 Modification By Agreement The terms and conditions of This Tariff other than the maximum rates set forth hereinmay be modified by agreement between the Buyer and Seller when expressly set forthin the Service Agreement or the Confirmation Document. SERVICE SCHEDULE A NEGOTIATED CAPACITY AND ENERGYUnder CMS Generation Michigan Power L.L.C. Power Sales Tariff SECTION 1 - SERVICES TO BE RENDERED 1.1 Negotiated Capacity is capacity and associated energy which the Buyer may purchase from Seller during the period covered by a Confirmation Document. It is intended to provide both the Buyer and Seller with a wide range of flexibility in structuring transactions which are mutually beneficial, including negotiable degrees of firmness, variable capacity charges and variable time durations. 1.2 The Buyer may reserve such Negotiated Capacity as Seller may have and is willing to make available. Seller and the Buyer shall agree on the number of megawatts and the period of reservation. Such agreement shall be documented in the Confirmation Document. At the request of the Buyer, but subject to the agreement of Seller, the Buyer may supply fuel to the Seller in exchange for Negotiated Capacity and associated energy. 1.3 The degree of firmness, which may range from firm service to non firm service, shall be mutually agreed upon by both parties (and documented in the Confirmation Document) at the time the power is reserved. Longer term sales shall have priority over shorter term sales of the same or similar type. Interruptions or curtailments if necessary will be exercised pursuant to Subsection 4.3 of this Tariff. 1.4 As specified in this Service Schedule, the term "year" shall mean any twelve month period ending at 12 o'clock midnight on the eve of the one-year anniversary of its starting date; the term "month" shall mean all of the days in any calendar month or, if a reservation starts on any day other than the first day of the month, the number of days in the month in which the reservation commences; the term "week" shall mean any seven consecutive days; the term "day" shall mean a twenty-four hour period commencing at twelve o'clock midnight Eastern Standard Time or Eastern Daylight Saving Time, whichever time is in effect on the Seller's system, and ending at the next following twelve o'clock midnight; and the term "hour" shall mean any clock hour. 1.5 In the absence of any conditions or limitations set forth in this Service Schedule or the Tariff of which it is a part, the Buyer shall specify in its notice to Seller (a) the type of service (Firm or Non-Firm) required, (b) the reserved quantity, (c) the reservation period, (d) the Receiving Party (if other than the Buyer) and (e) such other information, terms or conditions as may be mutually agreed upon by the Parties. 1.6 Unless otherwise mutually agreed, the Buyer shall provide Seller with advance written notice of not less than thirty (30) days for yearly Negotiated Capacity, not less than three (3) business days for monthly Negotiated Capacity, and by noon of the previous business day for weekly Negotiated Capacity. All other requests for Negotiated Capacity made by the Buyer may be made verbally with as much advance notice as is practicable in the circumstances, but shall be confirmed in writing. 1.7 During each period that Negotiated Capacity has been reserved, Seller shall, upon request by the Buyer, deliver (or accept) associated electric energy (Energy) to the Receiving Party during each hour requested by the Buyer, not to exceed the number of megawatts reserved. 1.8 When the Seller needs to curtail deliveries to the Receiving Party, Seller may, upon verbal notice to the Buyer, such notice to be later confirmed in writing if requested by the Buyer, reduce the number of megawatts reserved by such amount as it shall specify in such notice. SECTION 2 – COMPENSATION 2.1 For Negotiated Capacity reserved pursuant to Subsection 1.5 of this Service Schedule, the Buyer shall pay demand charges to Seller each month at the rates agreed by the Parties at the time the reservation is made, but not to exceed the following charges per megawatt reserved: Capacity Reserved From Capacity Reserved From System Capacity Reserved Livingston Plant Kalamazoo River Plant From Both Plants $5,587/MW/Month $8,085/MW/Month $6,394/MW/Month $1,289/MW/Week $1,866/MW/Week $1,475/MW/Week $258/MW/Day $373/MW/Day $295/MW/Day $16/MW/Hour $23/MW/Hour $18/MW/Hour 2.1.1 The total demand charge in any day, pursuant to a reservation for hourly Negotiated Capacity, shall not exceed the daily rate specified above times the highest amount of megawatts reserved in any hour during such day. 2.1.2 The total demand charge in any week, pursuant to a reservation for hourly or daily Negotiated Capacity, shall not exceed the weekly rates specified above times the highest amount of megawatts reserved during such week. 2.2 For Energy delivered pursuant to Subsection 1.7 of this Service Schedule, the Buyer shall pay energy charges to Seller each month at the rates specified in the following subsections: 2.2.1 For each megawatt hour delivered to the Receiving Party that is supplied from the Seller's Power Resources, up to 110% of the Out-of-Pocket Costsof supplying said megawatt hours (as defined in Subsection 5.9 of thisTariff); plus 2.2.2 For each megawatt hour delivered to the Receiving Party that is not suppliedfrom the Seller's Power Resources, 100% of the cost paid to the supplier ofsaid megawatt hours. 2.3 In applying the demand charges set forth in Subsection 2.1 and the energy charges set forth in Subsection 2.2.1, demand charges shall be based on the same generating units upon which energy is priced. 2.4 Notwithstanding that maximum rates are stated herein in terms of megawatts, Negotiated Capacity transactions may be arranged in kilowatts by mutual agreement of the parties in the Service Agreement and documented in the Confirmation Document. 2.5 When Buyer supplies the fuel, Seller will zero out the fuel cost in its calculation of Out-of-Pocket Cost for energy and will use the heat rates of those units providing such service to determine the amount of fuel delivered by the Buyer. In no event, shall the total compensation to Seller (which shall include the agreed value of the fuel) exceed the cumulative rate cap for demand and energy charges specified in Subsection 2.3 hereof. 2.6 Seller and Buyer may agree to fixed rates per megawatt hour for the term of an individual transaction provided, however, that in no case shall the compensation, over the term of the transaction, exceed the cumulative rate caps for capacity and energy set out in sections 2.1 and 2.21 or 2.22, as appropriate. SERVICE SCHEDULE B REACTIVE SUPPLY AND VOLTAGE CONTROL SERVICEUnder CMS Generation Michigan Power L.L.C. Power Sales Tariff SECTION 1 - SERVICES TO BE RENDERED 1.1 In order to maintain transmission voltages on the Transmission System within acceptable limits, generation facilities under the control of either the Independent System Operator (ISO) and/or the Control Area operator are operated to produce (or absorb) reactive power. Thus, generation facilities must supply Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service to either the ISO and/or Control Area. The amount of Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service that must be supplied will be determined based on the reactive power support necessary to maintain transmission voltages within limits that are generally accepted in the region and consistently adhered to by Transmission Provider. 1.2 Seller will recover this service under Schedule 2, or any successor schedule, of the applicable tariff of the Midwest Independent System Transmission Operator, Inc. (MISO) for the Fixed Capability Component. 1.3 Seller will recover for Opportunity Costs as directed by the FERC based on a separate filing. SECTION 2 – COMPENSATION 2.1 For Reactive Supply and Voltage Control reserved pursuant to this ServiceSchedule, the Buyer shall pay charges to Seller as given below: REVENUE REQUIREMENTS: FIXED CAPABILITY COMPONENT (Combined) The total annual revenue requirement for the Fixed Capability Component is $415,000.\ OPPORTUNITY COSTS CMSGMP will reserve its right to seek its opportunity costs in a separate filing before the Commission. CMS GENERATION MICHIGAN POWER, L.L.C.FERC SCHEDULE NO. 1 ELECTRIC TARIFF 1. Availability: CMS Generation Michigan Power, L.L.C. makes electric energy and capacity available under this Tariff to purchasers who have voluntarily negotiated a contract with CMS Generation Michigan Power, L.L.C. 2. Applicability: This tariff is applicable to purchases and sales of energy and/or capacity by CMS Generation Michigan Power, L.L.C. not otherwise subject to a specific tariff of CMS Generation Michigan Power, L.L.C. 3. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established between the purchaser and CMS Generation Michigan Power, L.L.C. 4. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between the purchaser and CMS Generation Michigan Power, L.L.C. 5. Compliance with Commission Regulations: Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning seller's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits the seller's market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning seller's market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff. 6. Waivers, Exemptions and Limitations: CMS Generation Michigan Power.L.L.C. has been granted the following waivers and blanket authorizations: (a) Parts 41, 101 and 141 of the Commission’s regulations with exception of sections 141.14 and 141.15, with respect to the accounting and reporting requirements of 18 C.F.R.; and (b) Subparts B and C of Part 35 of the Commission’s regulations, with the exception of sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15 and 35.16, with respect to the tariff filing requirements of 18 C.F.R. See CMS Generation Michigan Power. FERC Docket Nos. ER99-3637-000, Er99-3677-000, et al. Letter Order dated September 15, 1999. 7. Ancillary Services: Midwest ISO - Seller offers regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Midwest Independent Transmission System Operator, Inc. (Midwest ISO) and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to Midwest ISO. 8. Seller Category: Seller is a Category 2 Seller, as defined in 18 C.F.R. 35.36(a)(3), in the Central region. Seller is a Category 1 Seller, as defined in 18 C.F.R. 35.36 (a)(2), in all other regions.
